designScenario.name: Cabin Communication System
designScenario.description: The Cabin Communication System is a critical subsystem enabling seamless, secure, and reliable voice and data communication across the aircraft cabin. It integrates with the Avionics Network and Cabin Control Unit to provide real-time intercom, public address announcements, emergency alerts, and passenger communication interfaces. The system ensures redundancy, low-latency response, and compliance with aviation safety standards (FAA, EASA) while maintaining cybersecurity through encrypted protocols.

details.description: Enable bidirectional intercom communication between cabin crew members via handheld devices and fixed stations.
Support public address announcements to all cabin zones with adjustable volume and priority levels.
Activate emergency alerts with audible alarms, visual indicators, and pre-recorded evacuation instructions during critical events.
Facilitate passenger-to-crew communication via touchscreen panels and overhead service units.
Achieve latency below 1 second for emergency alert delivery and intercom response times.
Maintain audio clarity with signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) of at least 60 dB across all communication channels.
Support simultaneous operation of multiple communication streams without degradation in quality.
Implement dual redundant communication paths to ensure uninterrupted service during single-point failures.
Automatically prioritize emergency alerts over routine communications during critical situations.
Integrate with cabin safety systems to trigger coordinated responses (e.g., oxygen mask deployment alerts).
Employ AES-256 encryption for all transmitted data to prevent eavesdropping or tampering.
Adhere to DO-178C and DO-254 avionics software/hardware certification standards.
Provide a user-friendly touchscreen interface for crew operations with minimal training requirements.

systemComponents.name: Cabin Communication System
systemComponents.description: Centralized subsystem managing all cabin audio and data communication functions, interfacing with avionics and safety systems.

subComponents.name: Intercom Module
subComponents.description: Enables crew-to-crew intercom via dedicated channels with noise cancellation and priority override features.

subComponents.name: Public Address Subsystem
subComponents.description: Handles zone-specific announcements with dynamic volume control and priority management.

subComponents.name: Emergency Alert Module
subComponents.description: Triggers standardized emergency protocols including alarms, pre-recorded messages, and interface with cabin safety systems.

subComponents.name: Passenger Communication Interface
subComponents.description: Provides touch-based communication channels for passengers to request assistance or access information.

relationships.description: The Cabin Communication System includes the Intercom Module as a core functional component.
The Cabin Communication System incorporates the Public Address Subsystem for announcement distribution.
The Emergency Alert Module is a critical subcomponent of the Cabin Communication System for crisis management.
The Passenger Communication Interface is integrated into the Cabin Communication System for passenger interaction.
The Cabin Communication System exchanges operational status and commands with the Cabin Control Unit.
The Emergency Alert Module depends on cabin safety systems to trigger emergency protocols.
The Cabin Communication System aggregates data from the Avionics Network for system-wide status monitoring.
